page.title: 08Doctor House Area 2
page.content: This causes much noise, vibration and danger to the local residents. There have been appeals in the past for a small by-pass to be built to take the traffic away from the hamlet , but this appears to be a faint hope and the problem will probably continue for many years to come. Some of the{local place names}reveal links with the 17th century. 'Doctor House' and 'Doctor Lane' relate to a Doctor of Divinity who was a Parliamentary supporter in the English Civil War. He moved out of the potentiously dangerous regions to Delph, bought large areas of land and built farms on it. Fields such as 'Jericho' and 'Shiloh' were named by him. 'Valenciennes', another local name, was probably connected with the Huguenots who settled in the area.
